revised_title: The Anatomy and Physiology of the Air-Bladder and Weberian Ossicles in Siluroid Fishes
tldr: The authors studied the air-bladder and Weberian ossicles in siluroid fishes, exploring their anatomy and possible functions. They concluded that the Weberian ossicles are not related to hearing but are accessory to the hydrostatic function of the air-bladder, which helps the fish maintain its buoyancy and balance in water.
